page.title: 04Irby Primary School
page.content: Our school was developed as an evacuee organised at Irby Methodist Hall during the last war. At first children came from Wallasey but later the school was used by Channel Island refugees.So many people came,that they decided to build another one. Our school was built in 1951 and the first headmaster was called Mr.Hewitt but our present Headmaster is Mr.Rankin. There are 371 children in the school split up intp 12 classes. The school is in Coombe Road.If you go to the top of Coombe Road on a clear day,you can see a district in Lancashire which is called Black Coombe. by Caroline McGaw,aged 9
